author: iannorden
content: To add to that, at the core of vulcanizedb's toolchain is ipfs-blockchain-watcher https://github.com/vulcanize/ipfs-blockchain-watcher which is used to extract, transform, and load all eth (or btc) data into an IPFS-backing Postgres datastore while generating secondary indexes around that data in other Postgres tables. Then by using ipfs-ethdb https://github.com/vulcanize/ipfs-ethdb most native geth types can be built ontop of this ipfs datastore to expose much of the functionality and endpoints from geth, while new types and tools can be written to leverage the unique secondary indexes.
